data.name: Benne balls
data.description: A delightful (and somewhat jawbreaking) confection made of sesame seeds.

data.name: Blue food (cf. provision)
data.description: Dasheen is one of the hearty root vegetables (or ground provisions, as we say) popular in local cuisine. It has a bluish tinge, and is usually eaten boiled. Other common ground provisions include cassava, eddoes, sweet potato, yam and tania.

data.name: Buljol
data.description: Salted codfish shredded and seasoned with peppers, onions, tomatoes, and olive oil, often served in coconut bake.

data.name: Callaloo
data.description: Made from spinach-like dasheen leaves and okra; other ingredients may include coconut, crab and pigtail.

data.name: Coconut Bake
data.description: A type of bread made with grated coconut, often eaten at breakfast with buljol or cheese.

data.name: Cou-cou
data.description: A mixture of cornmeal, okra and butter, boiled and stirred till firm enough to be sliced (similar to polenta). Usually served with steamed fish and callaloo.

data.name: Crab n� dumpling
data.description: A filling, savoury dish in which the crab is stewed with curry and coconut milk and served over flat flour dumplings.

data.name: Doubles
data.description: Curried channa (chickpeas) sandwiched between two baras (fried flour and split pea bread), usually eaten with a dollop of hot mango kucheela.

data.name: Oildown
data.description: Breadfruit is the main ingredient here, combined with salted meat and boiled down in coconut milk. Called �rundown� in Jamaica.

data.name: Pacro Water
data.description: An aphrodisiac made by boiling a local crustacean. Definitely an acquired taste.

data.name: Pastelles
data.description: Meat-filled corn dumplings cooked in banana leaves. Vegetarian variations are filled with soya or lentil peas.

data.name: Pelau
data.description: Pigeon peas and rice cooked with meat, sometimes flavoured with coconut milk.

data.name: Phulouri
data.description: Small, deep-fried balls made from a mixture of ground split peas and flour, served with spicy chutney.

data.name: Pigeon peas
data.description: Pigeon peas and rice is a popular dish for Christmas and New Year, said to bring luck and prosperity.

data.name: Roti
data.description: A flour wrap, accompanied by curried meat (goat, chicken, lamb, beef, shrimp) or vegetables. Dhalpouri roti made with split peas, is a thin wrap; paratha roti (often called buss-up-shut) is served in fragments, used to scoop up the accompanying dishes; sada roti is slightly stiffer, usually served with choka � vegetables saut�ed Indian style.

data.name: Shark and bake
data.description: Fried leavened bread (bake) filled with a well-seasoned shark fillet, dressed with a variety of spicy condiments, including pepper, garlic, and chadon beni (cilantro) sauces.

data.name: Snow Cone or Sno-cone
data.description: Shaved ice, syrups made from guava, pineapple or kola and, if you ask for it, delicious, sinful condensed milk. Not just for kids.

data.name: Souse
data.description: Pig trotters boiled and served cold with a salty sauce of lime, cucumber, pepper and onions.
